altHandlingCost.description: The handling cost automatically calculates depending on the shipping method you select in the Ship Via field.To change the cost of handling, go to Lists > Shipping Items and select the shipping method with the handling cost you want to change.
altHandlingCost.name: altHandlingCost

altSalesTotal.description: The Alternate Sales Amount feature must be enabled in your account in order to populate this field. The value entered sets an Alternate Sales Amount for line items on the Estimate. This value can then be used for commission calculations.
altSalesTotal.name: altSalesTotal

altShippingCost.description: This is a read-only field that returns the shipping costs based on the shipping method selected in shipMethod.
altShippingCost.name: altShippingCost

billAddressList.externalId.description: Sets the billing address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Billing Address set on the associated Customer record. Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the Customer record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
billAddressList.externalId.name: billAddressList.externalId

billAddressList.internalId.description: Sets the billing address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Billing Address set on the associated Customer record. Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the Customer record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
billAddressList.internalId.name: billAddressList.internalId

billAddressList.name.description: Sets the billing address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Billing Address set on the associated Customer record. Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the Customer record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
billAddressList.name.name: billAddressList.name

billingSchedule.externalId.description: Choose the billing schedule you want to associate with this transaction.When you select a billing schedule, all items on the order are billed according to the billing schedule.Click New to enter a new billing schedule.When you create a new billing schedule on-the-fly, it can be identified as Public or Private. Private billing schedules show only in the transaction it is created from. If you create a private billing schedule from an estimate, that schedule is attached to items on the resulting sales order.Go to <_TABNAME=EDIT_BILLINGSCHEDULE_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=EDIT_BILLINGSCHEDULE_> > Billing Schedules for details about existing billing schedules.
billingSchedule.externalId.name: billingSchedule.externalId

billingSchedule.internalId.description: Choose the billing schedule you want to associate with this transaction.When you select a billing schedule, all items on the order are billed according to the billing schedule.Click New to enter a new billing schedule.When you create a new billing schedule on-the-fly, it can be identified as Public or Private. Private billing schedules show only in the transaction it is created from. If you create a private billing schedule from an estimate, that schedule is attached to items on the resulting sales order.Go to <_TABNAME=EDIT_BILLINGSCHEDULE_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=EDIT_BILLINGSCHEDULE_> > Billing Schedules for details about existing billing schedules.
billingSchedule.internalId.name: billingSchedule.internalId

billingSchedule.name.description: Choose the billing schedule you want to associate with this transaction.When you select a billing schedule, all items on the order are billed according to the billing schedule.Click New to enter a new billing schedule.When you create a new billing schedule on-the-fly, it can be identified as Public or Private. Private billing schedules show only in the transaction it is created from. If you create a private billing schedule from an estimate, that schedule is attached to items on the resulting sales order.Go to <_TABNAME=EDIT_BILLINGSCHEDULE_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=EDIT_BILLINGSCHEDULE_> > Billing Schedules for details about existing billing schedules.
billingSchedule.name.name: billingSchedule.name

currency.externalId.description: If you do not use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, the currency of the customer you are creating this transaction for is shown here.If you use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, select the transaction currency you want to create this transaction in. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.If you have already selected items on this transaction, selecting a new currency refreshes them to show the price in the new currency (except for items you entered custom prices for) and recalculates tax and gross profit.
currency.externalId.name: currency.externalId

currency.internalId.description: If you do not use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, the currency of the customer you are creating this transaction for is shown here.If you use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, select the transaction currency you want to create this transaction in. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.If you have already selected items on this transaction, selecting a new currency refreshes them to show the price in the new currency (except for items you entered custom prices for) and recalculates tax and gross profit.
currency.internalId.name: currency.internalId

currency.name.description: If you do not use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, the currency of the customer you are creating this transaction for is shown here.If you use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, select the transaction currency you want to create this transaction in. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.If you have already selected items on this transaction, selecting a new currency refreshes them to show the price in the new currency (except for items you entered custom prices for) and recalculates tax and gross profit.
currency.name.name: currency.name

currencyName.description: A read only field that defaults to the currency associated with the customer referenced by the entity field.
currencyName.name: currencyName

customForm.externalId.description: Select the customized estimate form to use.
customForm.externalId.name: customForm.externalId

customForm.internalId.description: Select the customized estimate form to use.
customForm.internalId.name: customForm.internalId

customForm.name.description: Select the customized estimate form to use.
customForm.name.name: customForm.name

department.externalId.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. Depending on account configuration, this field may need to be set at the item line level.
department.externalId.name: department.externalId

department.internalId.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. Depending on account configuration, this field may need to be set at the item line level.
department.internalId.name: department.internalId

department.name.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. Depending on account configuration, this field may need to be set at the item line level.
department.name.name: department.name

discountItem.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Items > New > Discount.
discountItem.externalId.name: discountItem.externalId

discountItem.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Items > New > Discount.
discountItem.internalId.name: discountItem.internalId

discountItem.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Items > New > Discount.
discountItem.name.name: discountItem.name

discountRate.description: Defaults to the rate associated with the value set in the discountItem field.
discountRate.name: discountRate

discountTotal.description: A read-only calculated field that returns the amount discounted on this Estimate. If this discount item is taxable, the discount is applied before taxes. If it is not taxable, the discount is applied after taxes.
discountTotal.name: discountTotal

dueDate.description: Sets the due date for this Estimate.
dueDate.name: dueDate

endDate.description: Sets the end date for this Estimate.
endDate.name: endDate

entity.externalId.description: Sets the customer this Estimate is associated with. Required on Add.
entity.externalId.name: entity.externalId

entity.internalId.description: Sets the customer this Estimate is associated with. Required on Add.
entity.internalId.name: entity.internalId

entity.name.description: Sets the customer this Estimate is associated with. Required on Add.
entity.name.name: entity.name

entityStatus.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Sales > Setup Tasks > Customer Statuses. Defaults to the value set at Setup > Sales > Sales Preferences.
entityStatus.externalId.name: entityStatus.externalId

entityStatus.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Sales > Setup Tasks > Customer Statuses. Defaults to the value set at Setup > Sales > Sales Preferences.
entityStatus.internalId.name: entityStatus.internalId

entityStatus.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Sales > Setup Tasks > Customer Statuses. Defaults to the value set at Setup > Sales > Sales Preferences.
entityStatus.name.name: entityStatus.name

entityTaxRegNum.externalId.displayName: Customer Tax Reg. Number - External id
entityTaxRegNum.externalId.name: entityTaxRegNum.externalId

entityTaxRegNum.internalId.displayName: Customer Tax Reg. Number - Internal id
entityTaxRegNum.internalId.name: entityTaxRegNum.internalId

estGrossProfit.description: Estimated Gross Profit: Read-only field that equals the revenue amount minus the Est. Cost. At the transaction level, it equals the gross profit of all lines, factoring transaction-level discounts and markups.
estGrossProfit.name: estGrossProfit

estGrossProfitPercent.description: Estimated Gross Profit Margin, as a percentage: Read-only field that equals the Est. Gross Profit divided by revenue, expressed as a percentage. At the transaction level, it equals the gross profit percent of all lines, factoring transaction-level discounts and markups.
estGrossProfitPercent.name: estGrossProfitPercent

exchangeRate.description: Required on Add. Defaults to the exchange rate associated with the Customer set in the entity field.
exchangeRate.name: exchangeRate

expectedCloseDate.description: Required on Add. Defaults to the current date.
expectedCloseDate.name: expectedCloseDate

fob.description: Sets the location where the customers technically acquire ownership.
fob.name: fob

forecastType.externalId.description: References an existing Forecast Type defined at Setup > Sales > Sales Preferences > Forecast (subtab on Preferences page). Note that although the display name for each forecast type can be customized, the actual internal ID associated with each forecast type is static as follows: Low Forecast Name: 1 Medium Forecast Name: 2 High Forecast Name: 3
forecastType.externalId.name: forecastType.externalId

forecastType.internalId.description: References an existing Forecast Type defined at Setup > Sales > Sales Preferences > Forecast (subtab on Preferences page). Note that although the display name for each forecast type can be customized, the actual internal ID associated with each forecast type is static as follows: Low Forecast Name: 1 Medium Forecast Name: 2 High Forecast Name: 3
forecastType.internalId.name: forecastType.internalId

forecastType.name.description: References an existing Forecast Type defined at Setup > Sales > Sales Preferences > Forecast (subtab on Preferences page). Note that although the display name for each forecast type can be customized, the actual internal ID associated with each forecast type is static as follows: Low Forecast Name: 1 Medium Forecast Name: 2 High Forecast Name: 3
forecastType.name.name: forecastType.name

handlingCost.description: The handling cost automatically calculates depending on the shipping method you select in the Ship Via field.To change the cost of handling, go to <_TABNAME=EDIT_SHIPITEM_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=EDIT_SHIPITEM_> > Shipping Items and select the shipping method with the handling cost you want to change.
handlingCost.name: handlingCost

handlingTax1Rate.description: The tax rate for this handling shipping item is shown here.
handlingTax1Rate.name: handlingTax1Rate

handlingTaxCode.externalId.description: Select the tax code for this handling shipping item.
handlingTaxCode.externalId.name: handlingTaxCode.externalId

handlingTaxCode.internalId.description: Select the tax code for this handling shipping item.
handlingTaxCode.internalId.name: handlingTaxCode.internalId

handlingTaxCode.name.description: Select the tax code for this handling shipping item.
handlingTaxCode.name.name: handlingTaxCode.name

includeInForecast.description: Check this box to include this estimate in sales forecast reports, key performance indicators and snapshots.If this estimate has a probability below the min. probability you set at Setup > Set Up SFA > Forecasts, it will not appear on reports, key performance indicators and snapshots. If you use NetSuite or NetCRM and this estimate was created from an opportunity, checking this box removes the opportunity from the sales forecast. Clearing this box includes the opportunity instead.
includeInForecast.name: includeInForecast

isTaxable.description: Place a check mark in this box if the order you are quoting will be taxable.
isTaxable.name: isTaxable

job.externalId.description: Select the project this estimate is associated with.
job.externalId.name: job.externalId

job.internalId.description: Select the project this estimate is associated with.
job.internalId.name: job.internalId

job.name.description: Select the project this estimate is associated with.
job.name.name: job.name

leadSource.externalId.description: Defaults to the lead source associated with the entity set in the entity field. If a lead source is not associated with the entity, and a default lead source has been set up, defaults to the value set at Setup > Marketing > Set Up Marketing. The lead source can reference either of the following: If marketing automation is NOT enabled, this field references a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Sales > Setup Tasks > CRM Lists. If marketing automation IS enabled, this field references a value in the campaign list at Lists > Marketing > Campaigns.
leadSource.externalId.name: leadSource.externalId

leadSource.internalId.description: Defaults to the lead source associated with the entity set in the entity field. If a lead source is not associated with the entity, and a default lead source has been set up, defaults to the value set at Setup > Marketing > Set Up Marketing. The lead source can reference either of the following: If marketing automation is NOT enabled, this field references a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Sales > Setup Tasks > CRM Lists. If marketing automation IS enabled, this field references a value in the campaign list at Lists > Marketing > Campaigns.
leadSource.internalId.name: leadSource.internalId

leadSource.name.description: Defaults to the lead source associated with the entity set in the entity field. If a lead source is not associated with the entity, and a default lead source has been set up, defaults to the value set at Setup > Marketing > Set Up Marketing. The lead source can reference either of the following: If marketing automation is NOT enabled, this field references a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Sales > Setup Tasks > CRM Lists. If marketing automation IS enabled, this field references a value in the campaign list at Lists > Marketing > Campaigns.
leadSource.name.name: leadSource.name

location.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. Depending on account configuration, this field may need to be set at the item line level.
location.externalId.name: location.externalId

location.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. Depending on account configuration, this field may need to be set at the item line level.
location.internalId.name: location.internalId

location.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. Depending on account configuration, this field may need to be set at the item line level.
location.name.name: location.name

memo.description: If you wish, enter a memo to describe this estimate. It will appear on reports such as the 2-line Estimates register that your customers can see if you give them permission to log in and view their transaction history.
memo.name: memo

message.description: Defaults to the value selected in messageSel.
message.name: message

messageSel.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Customer Message.
messageSel.externalId.name: messageSel.externalId

messageSel.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Customer Message.
messageSel.internalId.name: messageSel.internalId

messageSel.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Customer Message.
messageSel.name.name: messageSel.name

nexus.externalId.description: This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.
nexus.externalId.name: nexus.externalId

nexus.internalId.description: This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.
nexus.internalId.name: nexus.internalId

nexus.name.description: This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.
nexus.name.name: nexus.name

opportunity.externalId.description: Sets the Opportunity to associate with this Estimate. Valid options include all Opportunities associated with the selected Entity. Therefore, you will need to first perform a search for opportunities related to the desired entity
opportunity.externalId.name: opportunity.externalId

opportunity.internalId.description: Sets the Opportunity to associate with this Estimate. Valid options include all Opportunities associated with the selected Entity. Therefore, you will need to first perform a search for opportunities related to the desired entity
opportunity.internalId.name: opportunity.internalId

opportunity.name.description: Sets the Opportunity to associate with this Estimate. Valid options include all Opportunities associated with the selected Entity. Therefore, you will need to first perform a search for opportunities related to the desired entity
opportunity.name.name: opportunity.name

otherRefNum.description: Sets the customer PO number associated with this estimate.
otherRefNum.name: otherRefNum

partner.externalId.description: References an existing partner record. Defaults to the partner set on the entity record.
partner.externalId.name: partner.externalId

partner.internalId.description: References an existing partner record. Defaults to the partner set on the entity record.
partner.internalId.name: partner.internalId

partner.name.description: References an existing partner record. Defaults to the partner set on the entity record.
partner.name.name: partner.name

probability.description: Required on Add.Defaults to the probability of the status selected. Status probability defaults are defined at Setup > Customer Status Definitions. If this estimate is for a prospect, the prospect's record is updated with the value entered here.
probability.name: probability

promoCode.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Marketing > Promotion Codes. If default promotion codes are setup, defaults to the value set at Setup > Marketing > Marketing Preferences. Entities associated with a partner can only use that partner's promotion codes.
promoCode.externalId.name: promoCode.externalId

promoCode.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Marketing > Promotion Codes. If default promotion codes are setup, defaults to the value set at Setup > Marketing > Marketing Preferences. Entities associated with a partner can only use that partner's promotion codes.
promoCode.internalId.name: promoCode.internalId

promoCode.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Marketing > Promotion Codes. If default promotion codes are setup, defaults to the value set at Setup > Marketing > Marketing Preferences. Entities associated with a partner can only use that partner's promotion codes.
promoCode.name.name: promoCode.name

salesGroup.externalId.description: When team selling is enabled, this references a user defined sales team group at Lists > Relationships > Groups.
salesGroup.externalId.name: salesGroup.externalId

salesGroup.internalId.description: When team selling is enabled, this references a user defined sales team group at Lists > Relationships > Groups.
salesGroup.internalId.name: salesGroup.internalId

salesGroup.name.description: When team selling is enabled, this references a user defined sales team group at Lists > Relationships > Groups.
salesGroup.name.name: salesGroup.name

salesRep.externalId.description: Defaults to the sales representative associated with the customer referenced by the entity field. This field is NOT available when the Team Selling feature is enabled. If Team Selling is enabled, you must define sales reps in the EstimateSalesTeamList list.
salesRep.externalId.name: salesRep.externalId

salesRep.internalId.description: Defaults to the sales representative associated with the customer referenced by the entity field. This field is NOT available when the Team Selling feature is enabled. If Team Selling is enabled, you must define sales reps in the EstimateSalesTeamList list.
salesRep.internalId.name: salesRep.internalId

salesRep.name.description: Defaults to the sales representative associated with the customer referenced by the entity field. This field is NOT available when the Team Selling feature is enabled. If Team Selling is enabled, you must define sales reps in the EstimateSalesTeamList list.
salesRep.name.name: salesRep.name

shipAddressList.externalId.description: Sets the shipping address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Shipping Address set on the associated entity record. Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the entity record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
shipAddressList.externalId.name: shipAddressList.externalId

shipAddressList.internalId.description: Sets the shipping address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Shipping Address set on the associated entity record. Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the entity record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
shipAddressList.internalId.name: shipAddressList.internalId

shipAddressList.name.description: Sets the shipping address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Shipping Address set on the associated entity record. Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the entity record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
shipAddressList.name.name: shipAddressList.name

shipDate.description: Sets the ship date for this transaction.
shipDate.name: shipDate

shipMethod.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items. Sets the ship method for this transaction.
shipMethod.externalId.name: shipMethod.externalId

shipMethod.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items. Sets the ship method for this transaction.
shipMethod.internalId.name: shipMethod.internalId

shipMethod.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items. Sets the ship method for this transaction.
shipMethod.name.name: shipMethod.name

shippingCost.description: Sets the shipping cost for this transaction. If your account is set up to automatically charge for shipping, this defaults to the value that corresponds to the shipping method selected. Shipping items can be added at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Item.
shippingCost.name: shippingCost

shippingTax1Rate.description: The tax rate for this shipping item tax code is show here.
shippingTax1Rate.name: shippingTax1Rate

shippingTaxCode.externalId.description: Select the tax code to apply to this shipping item.
shippingTaxCode.externalId.name: shippingTaxCode.externalId

shippingTaxCode.internalId.description: Select the tax code to apply to this shipping item.
shippingTaxCode.internalId.name: shippingTaxCode.internalId

shippingTaxCode.name.description: Select the tax code to apply to this shipping item.
shippingTaxCode.name.name: shippingTaxCode.name

startDate.description: If there is an expected closing date for this estimate, accept today's date or enter a new date here.
startDate.name: startDate

subTotal.description: This is a read-only field that returns the total before any discounts, shipping cost, handling cost or tax is added to the order.
subTotal.name: subTotal

subsidiary.externalId.description: This field displays the subsidiary associated with this transaction.
subsidiary.externalId.name: subsidiary.externalId

subsidiary.internalId.description: This field displays the subsidiary associated with this transaction.
subsidiary.internalId.name: subsidiary.internalId

subsidiary.name.description: This field displays the subsidiary associated with this transaction.
subsidiary.name.name: subsidiary.name

subsidiaryTaxRegNum.externalId.description: This field shows the tax registration number of the transaction nexus. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different tax registration number in the dropdown list, the corresponding nexus is automatically selected in the Nexus field.
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.externalId.displayName: Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number - External id
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.externalId.name: subsidiaryTaxRegNum.externalId

subsidiaryTaxRegNum.internalId.description: This field shows the tax registration number of the transaction nexus. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different tax registration number in the dropdown list, the corresponding nexus is automatically selected in the Nexus field.
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.internalId.displayName: Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number - Internal id
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.internalId.name: subsidiaryTaxRegNum.internalId

subsidiaryTaxRegNum.name.description: This field shows the tax registration number of the transaction nexus. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different tax registration number in the dropdown list, the corresponding nexus is automatically selected in the Nexus field.
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.name.name: subsidiaryTaxRegNum.name

syncPartnerTeams.description: Check this box if you want to update the partner team on the customer record with changes you make here.
syncPartnerTeams.name: syncPartnerTeams

syncSalesTeams.description: Check this box if you want to update the sales team on the customer's record with changes you make here.
syncSalesTeams.name: syncSalesTeams

tax2Total.description: NetSuite multiplies the tax rate by the taxable total of line items and enters it here.
tax2Total.name: tax2Total

taxDetailsOverride.description: Check this box to override the tax information on the Tax Details subtab of the transaction. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the tax details.
taxDetailsOverride.name: taxDetailsOverride

taxItem.externalId.description: A tax item is a tax that you collect at one certain rate and pay to one tax agency for this invoice. NetSuite inserts the tax item for this customer from the record at Lists > Customers. To change it just for this estimate, select another tax item.To add additional choices to this list, go to Lists > New Item > Sales Tax Item.
taxItem.externalId.name: taxItem.externalId

taxItem.internalId.description: A tax item is a tax that you collect at one certain rate and pay to one tax agency for this invoice. NetSuite inserts the tax item for this customer from the record at Lists > Customers. To change it just for this estimate, select another tax item.To add additional choices to this list, go to Lists > New Item > Sales Tax Item.
taxItem.internalId.name: taxItem.internalId

taxItem.name.description: A tax item is a tax that you collect at one certain rate and pay to one tax agency for this invoice. NetSuite inserts the tax item for this customer from the record at Lists > Customers. To change it just for this estimate, select another tax item.To add additional choices to this list, go to Lists > New Item > Sales Tax Item.
taxItem.name.name: taxItem.name

taxRate.description: NetSuite inserts the percentage rate of the tax item from its record at Lists > Items. You can change it here for just this transaction if you wish.
taxRate.name: taxRate

taxRegOverride.description: Check this box to override the values in the Nexus and Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number fields. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the values that NetSuite automatically selects in these fields.
taxRegOverride.name: taxRegOverride

taxTotal.description: NetSuite multiplies the tax rate by the taxable total of line items and enters it here.
taxTotal.name: taxTotal

terms.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Term. This value sets the discount term to apply to the Estimate.
terms.externalId.name: terms.externalId

terms.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Term. This value sets the discount term to apply to the Estimate.
terms.internalId.name: terms.internalId

terms.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Term. This value sets the discount term to apply to the Estimate.
terms.name.name: terms.name

title.description: Enter a title for this estimate. The estimate title text appears on lists, shows in search and reporting results, and shows on the Estimates subtab of records it is associated with. When an estimate is converted from an opportunity, the title from the opportunity defaults into the title field on the estimate.   If there is already an estimate against the opportunity, then the second estimate has a number following the title. For example, if the first estimate title is “Project Estimate”, then the second estimate title is “Project Estimate1”. For each subsequent estimate created against that opportunity, the number in the title increases by 1 to help distinguish between multiple estimates associated to a single opportunity. The estimate title field is also available for customization, direct list editing, and mass updates.
title.name: title

toBeEmailed.description: Causes the Estimate to be mailed to all email addresses included in the email field.
toBeEmailed.name: toBeEmailed

toBeFaxed.description: Causes the Estimate to be faxed to the fax number included in the fax field.
toBeFaxed.name: toBeFaxed

toBePrinted.description: If enabled, this Estimate is saved in a queue of Estimates that can be printed at a later date.
toBePrinted.name: toBePrinted

total.description: This is a read-only field that returns the total of line items, tax and shipping costs.
total.name: total

totalCostEstimate.description: Estimated Cost: Estimated cost of the specific number of items; estimated rate x quantity = estimated cost.
totalCostEstimate.name: totalCostEstimate

trackingNumbers.description: Sets the shipping tracking number from the shipping company.
trackingNumbers.name: trackingNumbers

tranDate.description: Required on Add. Defaults to the current date.
tranDate.name: tranDate

tranId.description: Defaults to the largest Estimate number incremented by one. You can overwrite with another number.
tranId.name: tranId

type.value.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. Depending on account configuration, this field may need to be set at the item line level.
type.value.name: type.value

visibleToCustomer.description: Check the Available in Customer Center box to make this estimate available to customers in the Customer Center. Clear this box to leave this estimate off the list of estimates available to customers in the Customer Center.This field is checked by default.
visibleToCustomer.name: visibleToCustomer
